title: Saudi Arabia Repositions Sovereign Fund for Strategic Growth
description: Saudi Arabia is shifting focus from real estate gigaprojects to sustainable near-term returns for its $925 billion Public Investment Fund. The new strategy focuses on logistics, mineral exploitation, and religious tourism. Investments will emphasize artificial intelligence and data centers, as gigaproject delays have prompted strategic reevaluation.
content: Saudi Arabia is pivoting its $925 billion sovereign wealth fund away from large-scale real estate projects, a shift reported by a source with direct knowledge of the country's plans. This strategic realignment underlines a move towards more sustainab... [732 chars]

title: An AI Data Center Is Coming for Your Backyard. Here’s What That Means for You
description: The rise of artificial intelligence is driving a surge of data center construction across the United States, and rural communities are feeling the impact.
content: Elena Schlossberg and her husband bought their property in Prince William County, Virginia, in 2000. Over the years, the rise of artificial intelligence has transformed their bucolic community into a major hub for data centers, and Mrs. Schlossberg i... [6465 chars]

title: India Unveils AI-Driven Leap in Rice Sorting Technology at BIRC 2025
description: India is set to unveil its first Artificial Intelligence-based rice sorting system at the Bharat International Rice Conference (BIRC) 2025. This innovation will enhance precision and efficiency in rice exports, showcasing India's technological prowess and aiding its agricultural sector on the global stage.
content: India is poised to unveil its groundbreaking Artificial Intelligence-driven rice sorting system at the Bharat International Rice Conference (BIRC) 2025. The event, set to take place on October 30-31 at Bharat Mandapam, underscores India's growing dom... [523 chars]

title: Amazon layoffs hit India operations; Prime Video, Devices teams among those impacted
description: The layoffs are part of Amazon’s broader global restructuring drive announced earlier this week. The company said it would cut about 14,000 roles worldwide as it seeks to streamline operations and remove management layers to become “more agile” while investing heavily in artificial intelligence.

title: Emerging Markets Soar Amid AI Optimism and Trade Truce Hopes
description: An index tracking emerging market equities reached its highest in over four years, driven by easing Sino-U.S. trade tensions and artificial intelligence advancements. The MSCI EM equities index gained nearly 1%, with currencies also strengthening ahead of a Federal Reserve call on monetary policy.
content:
In a notable development, an index tracking emerging market equities surged to a peak not seen in over four years, buoyed by indications of easing tensions between the U.S. and China, alongside rising enthusiasm for artificial intelligence.

title: BIRC 2025 to showcase live launch of India's first AI
description: The two-day Bharat International Rice Conference (BIRC) 2025, starting Thursday at Bharat Mandapam here in the national capital, is set to highlight India's growing leadership in the global rice sector in what the organisers assert a live launch of the country's first Artificial Intelligence (AI)-based rice sorting system.

title: After firing 14,000 employees, Amazon tells remaining staff to lean in on AI
description: Amazon has reportedly laid off employees from its OS & Services group as part of its larger plan to trim around 14,000 corporate roles across departments. What followed was a clear message to the remaining workforce: adapt quickly and embrace artificial intelligence.
content: Amazon is once again tightening its workforce, this time focusing on its devices division — the team responsible for consumer hardware such as Kindle e-readers, Fire tablets, and Echo smart speakers. The company has reportedly laid off employees from... [2787 chars]
